member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
This method compares the current structure with another object of the same type. If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. NullableDecimal are ordered in following ascending order:
null NullableDecimal.MinValue 0 NullableDecimal.MaxValue
member.remarks: If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. This deviates from traditional mathmatical analysis, but is more useful in practical terms, so two objects of null value are determined to be equal, both having a value of null.
member.returns: An integer according the specification.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: This determines whether this instance and a specified object are equal. If both null then they are equal, if one of the two is null and the other is not then the values are not equal, otherwise a test of the underlying types is performed.
member.returns: This returns true if value and this instance are the same type and represent the same value (if both null then true); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal.Equals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of the two instances of structures to determine if they are equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a bool. Returns True if the two values are equal, otherwise False.
If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal.NotEquals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of two instances of to determine if they are not equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a . Returns False if the two values are equal, otherwise true.
If x is null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.summary: Compares two instances of to determine if the first is greater than the second. Note: null is considered the least value, if both are null then they are equal.
member.returns:

If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal.op_Equality(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDecimal)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of the two instances of structures to determine if they are equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a bool. Returns True if the two values are equal, otherwise False.
If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a . Returns False if the two values are equal, otherwise true.
If x is null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.IO.JSCompressor
member.summary: This class is used to compress JavaScript code.
member.remarks: Compression in this case consists of removing comments and unnecessary whitespace. It can also remove almost all line feed characters between lines provided that semi-colons have been used to indicate all statement endpoints.

member.summary: Default constructor. Line feed removal defaults to true, variable name compression defaults to false.
member.overloads: There are three overloads for the constructor.

member.param: Pass true to remove line feeds wherever possible, false to leave them in the script.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.IO.JSCompressor.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This version takes the line feed removal option and variable name compression option.
member.param: Pass true to remove line feeds wherever possible, false to leave them in the script.
Pass true to compress variable names or false to leave variable names intact.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseComboBox.RegisterChildComboBoxToClearOnChange(Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseComboBox)
member.summary: Registers the supplied as a child combo box. The list of child combo boxes will be cleared and their IsLoaded flags set to false when this combo box selected value changes. When the parent combo box is a single combo box, then the child will be cleared. If the parent is a multiple combo box, then the child combo box will have the reload method of that combo box invoked. This requires the child combo box is loaded dynamically, and the ensure in list must be disabled.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseComboBox.DisableAutomaticSelectedValueFromRequest
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag determining whether or not the control will attempt to set the values from the request. (Default false, it will accept by default a value passed to the form on load) If there are values, and no selected values exist, and the list is not loaded, but there is a method setup to load the list, then the load method will be invoked automatically prior to setting the control, unless BOTH the selected value and selected text are supplied, in which case the selected and text will just be set from the supplied values. If only the value is supplied, then the "text" or "value" can apply to that value for simplicity.

If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Text.TokenParser
member.summary: Token parser class handles parsing tokens from large strings. Used as a base class to process blocks of strings searching for tokens to be replaced based upon processing. For example, an email template with tokens in it to be replaced by searching for a specific handle. The class uses regular expressions to fire events which can be subscribed to so that the string can be processed.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule
member.summary: Enumeration of daylight savings rules. Each that uses daylight savings has a DaylightSavingsRule enumeration.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.None
member.summary: No daylight savings.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.NorthAmericaUnitedStates
member.summary: North America daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM after the first Sunday in April if year is less than or equal to 2006. Otherwise daylight savings starts on the second Sunday in March at 2:00 AM.
Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM after the last Sunday in October if the year is less than or equal to 2006. Otherwise daylight savings ends on the first Sunday in November at 2:00 AM

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.MexicoChihuahuaMexicoCity
member.summary:
Mexico daylight savings rules.
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM after the first Sunday in April. Exception: 2001 - Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM after the first Sunday in May.
Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM after the last Sunday in October. Exception: 2001 - Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM after the last Sunday in September.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Santiago
member.summary: Chile daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 11:59:59 PM on the second Saturday in October.
Daylight savings ends at 11:59:59 PM on the second Saturday in March

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Brasilia
member.summary: Brazil daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Time Zone Rules Change in Brazil Often. The current release uses the most common rules for Brazil which are as follows:
Daylight savings starts at 11:59:59 PM on the third Saturday in october.
Daylight savings ends at 11:59:59 PM on the third Saturday in February.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.MidAtlantic
member.summary: Mid Atlantic daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM on the last Sunday in March.
Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM on the last Sunday in September.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Europe
member.summary: Europe daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM on the last Sunday in March.
Daylight savings ends at 3:00 AM on the last Sunday in October.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.GMT
member.summary: GMT daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 1:00 AM on the last Sunday in March.
Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM on the last Sunday in October.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Bucharest
member.summary: Bucharest daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Nearly the same as Europe, but has 3:00 AM on start and 4:00 AM on End
Daylight savings starts at 3:00 AM on the last Sunday of march.
Daylight savings ends at 4:00 AM on the last sunday of October.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Cairo
member.summary: Egypt daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 11:59:59 PM on the last Thursday of April.
Daylight savings ends at 11:59:59 PM on the last Thursday of September.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Helsinki
member.summary: Finland daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 3:00 AM on the last sunday of March.
Daylight savings ends at 4:00 AM on the last sunday of October.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Baghdad
member.summary: Iraq daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 3:00 AM on the first Sunday in April.
Daylight savings ends at 4:00 AM on the first Sunday in October.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Tehran
member.summary: Iran daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Rules may vary, went with Microsoft Default Settings:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM on the First Sunday of March.
Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM on the fourth Tuesday of September.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Adelaide
member.summary: Adelaide Australia daylight savings rules
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM on the last Sunday in October.
Daylight savings ends at 3:00 AM on the last Sunday in March.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Hobart
member.summary: Hobart daylight savings rules.
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM on the first Sunday in October.
Daylight savings ends at 3:00 AM on the last Sunday in March.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.Vladivostock
member.summary: DEPRICATED USES EUROPE RULES: Vladivostock daylight savings rules.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavingsRule.NorthAmericaUnitedStatesPRE2007
member.summary: Daylight savings rules US used prior to 2007
member.remarks:
Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM after the first Sunday in April. (Uses the pre 2007 rules)
Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM after the last Sunday in October.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.Registry
member.summary: The registry class is used to ensure that objects which are created within the context of a single registry are guaranteed to be the same reference to the object when it is created through this class more than once. The registry object also holds the values for the default database connection string and default smtp server to use with the application. By consolidating these common properties on the registry, the business objects and collections (which all have a registry property) may access these default values for connecting to the database and sending email throughout the application.
member.remarks: The registry class prevents the problem if an object like a "User" object, which may have a "Company" property, which has a "User" property. The registry guarantees that if the "User" object is created with the same id more than once, that the first object created is returned so that the two instances are referring to the same object.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.Registry.CustomObject1
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom #1, which can be used as a mechanism for passing custom business logic into any business object class library by an inheriting project/solution.
member.remarks: Use these properties within a specific project or application set at the page, registry level, so that child business object classes can have access to the object property and make business logic decisions based on this property. For example in the child application a class of custom properties that the business object need to have access to could be set and then business logic can be formulated based on the information in that class.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenTableLeftPaneHeader

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenRightMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen right margin (default 0). Set globally for your site depending on the screen surroundings that will be typical for most tables. For example, if there is an outer table cell for design purposes, the buffer may be needed.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenBottomMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen bottom margin (default 0). Set globally for your site depending on the screen surroundings that will be typical for most tables.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenLeftPaneMinimumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the split left pane minimum width (default 200). The left pane cannot be less than the amount set.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenLeftPaneDefaultMaxPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the nullable split screen default max percent (default 80 (%)). Used when automatically sizing the panes. Under default scenario, if the table exceeds the window size, the left pane will not be more than 80% of the screen unless a user drags the divider farther than the set value.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenLeftPaneDefaultMaxWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the nullable split screen default maximum pixels to set (default null). Used when automatically sizing the panes.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenFixedWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen fixed height. Used to constrain the split screen to a fixed height (used when the split screen is part of a user control). Full screen should be disabled when using this property.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenFixedHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen fixed width. Used to constrain the split screen to a fixed width (used when the split screen is part of a user control). Full screen should be disabled when using this property.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenOnlyLoadedDuringAjaxPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether or not the split screen is not output initially and only loaded during an ajax post back. Used for controls and other elements.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenDisableSmartScrolling
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether or not to disable the smart scrolling features. When used in a control the smart scrolling is not needed, so it is unnecessary to pass those parameters in the URL.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.SplitScreenDefaultRowHeight

If so, when the header is created, fields or properties are checked to ensure they have a database field that can be located via the attribute on the property. member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.JavaScriptRowMoveDropDetermineIfChildrenAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function called when determining whether or not a row can have children if the table is a tree, must return true or false. The javascript code MUST be formatted like this example: RowMoveDropDetermineIfChildrenAllowed(rowObjectDropOn); and must return true or false.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.JavaScriptRowMoveDropGetParentConfirmResult
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function called when determining whether or not the row should be added as a child of the row it was dropped on or not. The javascript code MUST be formatted like this example: RowMoveDropGetParentConfirmResult(rowObject, rowObjectDropOn); and must return true or false.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.JavaScriptOnBeforeRowMoveDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function called when a row is dragged then dropped on the table; must return true or false (false cancels default behavior). The javascript code MUST be formatted like this example: RowMoveDropOn(rowObjectDropOn); and must return true or false, false cancels default behavior, true runs normal behavior

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.JavaScriptOnAfterRowMoveDropPerformMove
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function called after a row is dragged then dropped on the table. The javascript code MUST be formatted like this example: RowAfterMoveDropPerformMove(rowObject, rowObjectDropOn, isChild);

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.EnableRowMoveDrop

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.JavaScriptOnAfterDeleteObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after deleting an object (recursive delete object may be called in the middle of this), passes the table object and the id of row object for the row that was deleted as inputs and has no return. Is called only after a valid response. The javascript code can be formatted like: function AfterDeleteObject(metafuseTable, id);

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTable.JavaScriptOnAfterExpandRow
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after expanding a row, passes the table object, the row object for the row that was expanded, and whether the children were loaded as inputs and has no return. The javascript code can be formatted like: function AfterExpandRow(metafuseTable, rowObject, loadedChildren);

member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after collapsing a row, passes the table object and the row object for the row that was collapsed as inputs and has no return. The javascript code can be formatted like: function AfterCollapseRow(metafuseTable, rowObject);

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
This method compares the current instance with another object of the same type. If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. NullableBooleans are ordered in following ascending order:
null false true
member.remarks: If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. This deviates from traditional mathmatical analysis, but is more useful in practical terms, so two objects of null value are determined to be equal, both having a value of null.
member.returns: An integer according the specification.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: This determines whether this instance and a specified object are equal. If both null then they are equal, if one of the two is null and the other is not then the values are not equal, otherwise a test of the underlying types is performed.
member.returns: This returns true if value and this instance are the same type and represent the same value (if both null then true); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean.Equals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of the two instances of structures to determine if they are equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a bool. Returns True if the two values are equal, otherwise False.
If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean.NotEquals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableBoolean)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of two instances of to determine if they are not equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a . Returns False if the two values are equal, otherwise true.
If x is null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.summary: Ensures the database connection is open and that any call will be in the context of a transaction.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Xml.XmlGuidList
member.summary: The XmlGuidList class contains several static methods to create XML strings containing values. member.name: M:Metafuse3.Web.UI.MetafuseBasePageTools.AddJavaScriptLibraryFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a JavaScript library (is located in site JS Root) that will be output into the head. De-Dupes the list.
member.param: name (not the path, must be in root) of the javascript library (excluding the javascript library path root) to the file that should be registered.
member.remarks: Controls can register libraries that are required to ensure that the application works.
The UIHead control must call GetJavaScriptLibraryFileIncludeHTML(root); in order to output the files that were setup in the base page.
member.example: If the AjaxObjectList JavaScript library needs to be output, you would indicate "AjaxObjectList.js" to output.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Web.UI.MetafuseBasePageTools.AddJavaScriptScriptFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a JavaScript script file to output into the head. The script files will be output into the head after the main library files. Root is automatically appended to the library file.
member.param: full path and name of the javascript library to the file that should be registered.
member.remarks: Controls can register libraries that are required to ensure that the application works.
The UIHead control must call GetJavaScriptLibraryFileIncludeHTML(""); in order to output the files that were setup in the base page.
member.example: If the AjaxObjectList JavaScript library needs to be output, you would indicate "SpecialJSFile.js" to output.

flag indicating whether or not the script is asynchronous

member.summary: Determines if the supplied date time falls within the daylight savings range for North America Time Zone Rule.
member.param: DateTime you wish to test for daylight savings.
whether or not the conversion is from the local time zone.
member.returns: whether or not the time is within daylight savings

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavings.NorthAmericaUnitedStates.GetDaylightSavingsStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Daylight savings start date for a given year in North America time zone rules. Daylight savings starts at 2:00 AM after the first Sunday in April if year is less than or equal to 2006. Otherwise daylight savings starts on the second Sunday in March at 2:00 AM.
member.returns: the given date time

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavings.NorthAmericaUnitedStates.GetDaylightSavingsEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Daylight savings end date for a given year in North America time zone rules. Daylight savings ends at 2:00 AM after the last Sunday in October if the year is less than or equal to 2006. Otherwise daylight savings ends on the first Sunday in November at 2:00 AM.
member.returns: the given date time

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Globalization.DateAndTime.DaylightSavings.NorthAmericaUnitedStates.GetDaylightSavingsRulesExplanation
member.summary: Gets the explanation of the daylight savings rules used for the daylight savings object.
member.returns: explanation of the daylight savings rules employed.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase
member.summary: Class contains the base functionality for all Metafuse web Application projects. The functionality the base page handles include: Creates the for the lifetime of the page. The base page handles the return URL properties. Handles the smart scrolling functions if enabled. Set the property EnableSmartScrolling to true.
member.remarks: When using the smart scrolling features default libraries for javascript must be sourced in to the form for it to work properly. The functions required are: the OnLoad.AddFunction methodology for hooking up multiple javascript onload events. Also the MetafuseSmartScrolling.js library must be included.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for the page base.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase.dynamicControlsPlaceHolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the for dynamically created web controls. Must be set in the constructor of the form.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase.OnLoad(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Method invoked when the OnLoad event is fired. Sets the PreviousPageUrl and ReturnUrl properties.
member.remarks: The method, when not a postback, sets up the PreviousPageUrl property by reading the Request["ReturnUrl"] parameter received by the form and the ReturnUrl property by building the script and query string parameters to return to the current page. When a postback the values are read from the view state.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Base PreRender method. Calls base.OnPreRender first, Then determines the print friendly and excel export status. Also handles the smart scrolling features.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase.ClientSideReturnUrlParametersPrefix
member.summary: Gets the additional return URL parameters prefix used when concatenating additional parameters from the client side, for example hidden fields other than the x,y coordinates used in.
member.remarks: Defaults to "_0", any parameters that are sent in from javascript, like coordinate values of the scrolling etc, they should use this prefix to be ignored in as a parameter for building the return url. member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.PageBase.EnableSmartScrolling
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which enables smart scrolling from the form. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: Be sure to include the MetafuseSmartScrolling.js library and include the OnLoad.AddFunction load hookup when enabling the smart scrolling. When sending the x and y scroll positions externally to this form on first load the names of the parameters should be "_x" and "_y". Sending those as a name value pair in the request will make the form scroll to those positions on first load.

Copies a directory and its contents to a new directory.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.PropertyDefinitionDataSet.IsObjectLoaded
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which determines whether or not the current object has been loaded from the database. The property is marked new so that each layer of the inheritence chain has it's own IsObjectLoaded property. Base layers may or may not be loaded. The IsObjectLoaded propery is automatically set to true when the object is loaded from the database. The IsObjectLoaded property is used primarily for the internal Load methods to determine whether or not the object needs to load itself when a property is accessed or the Load method is invoked.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.PropertyDefinitionDataSet.IsObjectDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which determines whether or not the current object has been updated and needs to be saved to the database. The property is marked new so that each layer of the inheritence chain has it's own IsObjectDirty property. Base layers may or may not be dirty. The IsObjectDirty flag should set to true when a property is updated, and the object automatically sets the IsObjectDirty flag to false when the object is saved successfully. The IsObjectDirty property is used primarly for the internal Save methods to determine whether or not the object needs to save itself when the Save method is invoked.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.PropertyDefinitionDataSet.IsObjectCreated
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which determines whether or not the current object has just been created (is new) and will need to be saved to the database. The property is marked new so that each layer of the inheritence chain has it's own IsObjectCreated property. The IsObjectCreated flag is automatically set to false when the object is saved. Base layers may or may not be created. The IsObjectCreated flag is set to false when saved.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.BusinessObjectCollectionBase.Delete(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlProcedureCommand)
member.summary:
Special method used to delete the properties of the current list members which are related to a specific Id field in a 2 field join table to the database.
Used when you are not trying to delete the actual objects located within the list, but rather the property of the related objects in the join table.
When using this method, the relationship is stored in a table where the Id supplied in the method is joined with the property of the objects within the list of this collection. This method does NOT call the delete method of the objects located in the list, therefore not deleting the object, rather only the relationship to the object.
member.remarks: When using this method, the relationship is stored in a table where the Id supplied in the method is joined with the property of the objects within the list of this collection. This method does NOT call the delete method of the objects located in the list, therefore not deleting the object, rather only the relationship to the object.
member.param: currently being used, if null a new connection is created.
currently being used, if null a new transaction is created.
stored procedure call used to delete the relationship records in the database.
member.returns: currently being used.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.BusinessObjectCollectionBase.Delete(Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlProcedureCommand)
member.summary: The method invokes the delete process, creates the connection, transaction calls the outer delete methods then commits or rolls back.
member.param: to use to delete the members of the list.

member.summary: Special method used to save the properties of the current list members which are related to a specific Id field in a 2 field join table to the database. Used when you are not trying to save the actual objects located within the list, but rather the property of the related objects to the join table.
member.remarks: When using this method, the relationship is stored in a table where the Id supplied in the method is joined with the property of the objects within the list of this collection. This method does NOT call the save method of the objects located in the list.
member.param: currently being used, if null a new connection is created.
currently being used, if null a new transaction is created.
stored procedure call used to delete the existing relational data that may be in the table (will be replaced with the Id's of the members in this list)
stored procedure call used to repopulate the relational data with what is currently in the list.
Id of the object to relate the list data to.
member.returns: currently being used.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.BusinessObjectCollectionBase.Save(Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlProcedureCommand,Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlProcedureCommand,System.String)
member.summary: Base "delete" method, should be overridden in child classes. The method has no implementation at the base level. Save collections are meant to handle the situation where there are associated records of separate objects. The save method should remove all the old records and repopulate with the new records. This method is typically used in the situation where there the table has two Id columns representing the the link between the objects.
member.remarks: The collection save command does not call the save method of the related items, but handles the situatiuon where the collection is a list of two sets of BusinessObjectBase objects where the table has two Id's to join the records together. When this method is called, all the related objects are deleted from the table then repopulated.
member.param: to use to delete the previous members of the list from the database.
to use to repopulate the database with the new members in the list.
field name of the Id of the objects that are in the list to repopulate.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormDefinition.JavaScriptOnValidateForm
member.summary:
Gets or sets the javascript function to call when validating an entry. Sends the "ajaxObjectList" and the "ajaxobjectId" that is being edited (if ajaxObjectId is null or "" then this is an add) to the method. function ValidateForm(metafuseTableFormDefinition, ajaxObjectIdEditing); The validation function handles the presentation of any error messages via alert or showing and/hiding an error summary. The javascript function must hide the error summary if successful and show the error summary if not successful. The javascript also must have a return value of true for valid and false for invalid. Since the ajax system must work seamlessly across browsers custom javascript must be used for validation that works across supported browsers.
The javascript code can be formatted like: function ValidateForm(metafuseTableFormDefinition, ajaxObjectIdEditing) and needs to return a bool indicating that the form is valid or not.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormDefinition.JavaScriptOnBeforeGetFormData
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after validation but before retrieving form data. The javascript code can be formatted like: function OnBeforeGetFormData(metafuseTableFormDefinition) does not return any value.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormDefinition.JavaScriptOnAfterGetFormData
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after retrieving and saving the form data. The javascript code can be formatted like: function OnAfterGetFormData(metafuseTableFormDefinition, ajaxObjectEditing) does not return any value.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination
member.summary: The Pagination struct contains information about paginated results. This information is dependant upon the , , and .
member.remarks: Both the record and page numbering are ones-based. If there are no records in the record count, the current page will be 0.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.currentPageNumber
member.summary: This stores the internal Int32 value indicating the current page number. This number will never be less than 0.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.pageSize
member.summary: This stores the internal Int32 value indicating the page size. This number will never be less than 0. If 0, the pagination was overridden to return all the results on one page.

member.summary: Constructor for the pagination class. Use when a maximum record count does NOT exist.

member.summary: Constructor for the pagination class. Use when a maximum record count exists.
member.param: the max records. (-1 for no maximum)

member.summary: Gets the current page number

member.summary: Gets the next page number.

member.summary: Gets the next page record count, the number of records on the next page.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.PageCount
member.summary: Gets the total page count.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.PageSize
member.summary: Gets the page size.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.PreviousPageNumber
member.summary: Gets the previous page number. If is 0, this will be 0.
member.remarks: If is 0, this will be 0.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.PreviousPageRecordCount
member.summary: Gets the number of records on the previous page. If is 1 or 0, this will be 0.
member.remarks: If is 1 or 0, this will be 0.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.RecordCount
member.summary: Gets the total record count. This number will always be a whole number. If there are no records, this will be 0.
member.remarks: This number will always be a whole number. If there are no records, this will be 0.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.RecordEnd
member.summary: Gets the record end. RecordEnd indicates the ones-based number for the current page's last record relative to the entire data set. If is 0, this will be 0.
member.remarks: If is 0, this will be 0.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.RecordStart
member.summary: Gets the record start. RecordStart indicates the ones-based number for the current page's first record relative to the entire data set.
member.remarks: If is 0, this will be 0.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Data.Pagination.MaxRecords
member.summary: Gets the max records for the pagination, if set. If not set returns -1.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.BusinessObjectCollectionRelationDefinition
member.summary: Contains the database query definition for the relationship of another object to the objects in the master collection. The definition class contains the database query definition the can use to load the related objects, loading the properties and/or setting related collections with a single query. Typical definitions can be added as static or instance properties of the which the relation will be queried from, this will allow a programmer to select multiple relations to query depending on the display or business logic. When loading multiple relations, make sure that child relations are called after parent relations so that the query optimization occurs. Use SQL Profiler or the Visual Studio Debugger to ensure that the relations are effective and preventing the individual objects from calling their load methods.
member.remarks: When loading multiple relations, make sure that child relations are called after parent relations so that the query optimization occurs. Use SQL Profiler or the Visual Studio Debugger to ensure that the relations are effective and preventing the individual objects from calling their load methods.

member.summary: This method prepares a string for rendering in HTML a string as it appears in text. The default behavior is to encode hyperlinks.
member.returns: Formatted HTML string.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.DisplayEncode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method prepares a string for rendering in HTML a string as it appears in text.
member.param: If true, this overrides the default behavior and will not encode hyperlinks.
member.returns: Formatted HTML string.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.ReserveCharacterEncode(System.String)
member.summary: This method remaps HTML reserved character to non-printable characters so they may safely pass through encodings.
member.remarks: These encoding as are internal only to this class and should never be passed outside the class.
member.returns: Encoded String.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.ReserveCharacterDecode(System.String)
member.summary: This method remaps non-printable characters back to their HTML reserved characters after these characters have safely passed through encodings.
member.returns: Dencoded String.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.HyperLinkEncode(System.String)
member.summary: This method encodes hyperlinks (URI's and email addresses) as valid HTML hyperlinks.
member.remarks:
URI's with the following protocols are supported:
http
https
ftp
news
mailto
The following are also supported:
Email addresses These are encoded with a MAILTO: tag.
URI's started with ftp. These are encoded with a hyperlink with ftp as the protocol.
URI's started with www. These are encoded with a hyperlink with http as the protocol.
member.returns: Encoded String.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.HyperLinkEncode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method encodes hyperlinks (URI's and email addresses) as valid HTML hyperlinks.
member.param: If true, HTML reserve characters are remapped so they are not encoded by HtmlEncode.
member.returns: Encoded String.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.JavaScriptEncode(System.String)
member.summary: This method takes a string and encodes it for rendering within a double-quoted HTML attribute as a Javascript string to be encapsulated with single-quotes. The default behavior is to not HTML encode the string.
member.returns: Formatted string.
member.remarks: This method would most likely be used in ASP.NET controls where HTML encoding is not necessary because ASP.NET does the HTML encoding automatically.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.JavaScriptEncode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method takes a string and encodes it for rendering within a double-quoted HTML attribute as a Javascript string to be encapsulated with single-quotes.
member.param: Boolean value that determines whether or not the string should be HTML encoded
member.returns: Formatted string.
member.remarks: This method would most likely be used in standard HTML controls where HTML encoding is necessary.

a.onclick: return confirm('Are you sure you would like to delete HtmlUtility.JavaScriptEncode(Item.Name)');

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Text.HtmlUtility.ToText(System.String)
member.summary: This method removes HTML formatting from a string.
member.remarks: The head, script, and style tags and contents are removed. All other HTML markup tags are removed leaving their contents.
member.returns: Text String.

member.summary: Stem All or or StemPhrases

member.summary: TrimPrefixAll or TrimPrefixPhraces

member.summary: Throw error on all or unbalanced quotes, or invalid near

member.summary: Stem Terms (Apply FORMSOF(INFLECTIONAL) when not a prefix term or adjoining a NEAR.)

member.summary: Stem Phrases

member.summary: Trim Prefix Phrases (will always result in no matches).

member.summary: Throw on unbalanced parens (Otherwise silently patches up and prevents under/overflow.)

member.summary: Throw on unbalaned quotes ( Otherwise closes at end and assumes inner single instance quotes are intentional.)

member.summary: Throw on invalid near use (Otherwise silently switches the bad NEARs to ANDs.)

member.summary: This stores the internal Boolean value indicating if the structure is Null or not. The default value for this variable is false which defaults an uninitialized structure to Null.

member.summary: This private constructor allows for construction of the static readonly field .

member.summary: This public constructor creates a new NullableInt32 from an Int32 whose value is equal to the value passed into the constructor. To create a null NullableInt32, use the static field .
member.param: The value parameter initializes the NullableInt32 value.

member.summary: A constant representing the largest possible value of the NullableInt32 Value property (2,147,483,647).

member.name: F:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.MinValue
member.summary: A constant representing the smallest possible value of the NullableInt32 Value property (-2,147,483,648).

member.name: F:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.Null
member.summary: Represents a null value that can be assigned to the NullableInt32 structure.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.Zero
member.summary: Represents a zero value that can be assigned to the Value property of an instance of the NullableInt32 structure.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
This method compares the current structure with another object of the same type. If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. NullableInt32 are ordered in following ascending order:
null NullableInt32.MinValue 0 NullableInt32.MaxValue
member.remarks: If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. This deviates from traditional mathmatical analysis, but is more useful in practical terms, so two objects of null value are determined to be equal, both having a value of null.
member.returns: An integer according the specification.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: This determines whether this instance and a specified object are equal. If both null then they are equal, if one of the two is null and the other is not then the values are not equal, otherwise a test of the underlying types is performed.
member.returns: This returns true if value and this instance are the same type and represent the same value (if both null then true); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.Equals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of the two instances of structures to determine if they are equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a bool. Returns True if the two values are equal, otherwise False.
If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.NotEquals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of two instances of to determine if they are not equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a . Returns False if the two values are equal, otherwise true.
If x is null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.GreaterThan(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32)
member.summary: Compares two instances of to determine if the first is greater than the second. Note: null is considered the least value, if both are null then they are equal.
member.returns:
Returns a that is true if x (first) is greater than the y (second), otherwise false.
If x is null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.GreaterThanOrEqual(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32)
member.summary: Compares two instances of to determine if the first is greater than or equal to the second. Note: null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal.
member.returns:
Returns a that is true if the x (first) is greater than or equal to y (second) instance, otherwise false.
If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32.LessThan(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableInt32)
member.summary: Compares two instances of to determine if the first is less than the second. Note: null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal.

If x is null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then true is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor
member.summary: This class is used to compress JavaScript code.
member.remarks: Compression in this case consists of removing comments and unnecessary whitespace. It can also remove almost all line feed characters between lines provided that semi-colons have been used to indicate all statement endpoints.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Line feed removal defaults to true, variable name compression defaults to false.
member.overloads: There are three overloads for the constructor.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This version takes the line feed removal option. Variable name compression defaults to false.
member.param: Pass true to remove line feeds wherever possible, false to leave them in the script.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This version takes the line feed removal option and variable name compression option.
member.param: Pass true to remove line feeds wherever possible, false to leave them in the script.
Pass true to compress variable names or false to leave variable names intact.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.Compress(System.String)
member.summary: Compress the specified JavaScript code.
member.returns: The compressed script

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.LineFeedRemoval
member.summary: Get or set the line feed removal option.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.CompressVariableNames
member.summary: Get or set the variable name compression option.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Install.JSCompressor.TestVariableNameCompression
member.summary: This is used to test variable name compression only
member.remarks: If set to true, only variable names will be compressed. This makes it easier to debug possible issues with the variable name compression code.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen
member.summary: Control handles client side split screen capabilities, performs the hookups for the split screens. Normally 4 tables are supplied to make up the split screen, a "left pane header", "left pane", "right pane header" and "right pane". The control automatically adds the divider bar(s). Optionally the split screen can render a 2 pane split screen. When using a 2 pane split screen you must set the right pane header control and right pane control before the pre-render of the control. When using a split screen with 4 panes then all 4 must be set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the which will be rendered in the upper right hand corner of the split screen control. Typically you would supply an , but you are not required to do so. Required for a 2 or 4 pane split screen.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.RightPaneControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the which will be rendered in the lower right hand corner of the split screen control. Typically you would supply an , but you are not required to do so. Required for a 2 and 4 pane split screen.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.LeftPaneDefaultWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the default width in pixels of the left pane, if none are set the default is used. The width may be resized by the client depending on the options chosen.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenRightMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen right margin (default 0). Set globally for your site depending on the screen surroundings that will be typical for most tables. For example, if there is an outer table cell for design purposes, the buffer may be needed.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenBottomMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen bottom margin (default 0). Set globally for your site depending on the screen surroundings that will be typical for most tables.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenLeftPaneMinimumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the split left pane minimum width (default 200). The left pane cannot be less than the amount set.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenLeftPaneDefaultMaxPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the nullable split screen default max percent (default 80 (%)). Used when automatically sizing the panes. Under default scenario, if the table exceeds the window size, the left pane will not be more than 80% of the screen unless a user drags the divider farther than the set value.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenLeftPaneDefaultMaxWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the nullable split screen default maximum pixels to set (default null). Used when automatically sizing the panes.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenRightPaneMinimumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen bottom margin (default 200). The right pane cannot be less than the amount set.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenFixedWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen fixed height. Used to constrain the split screen to a fixed height (used when the split screen is part of a user control). Full screen should be disabled when using this property.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenFixedHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen fixed width. Used to constrain the split screen to a fixed width (used when the split screen is part of a user control). Full screen should be disabled when using this property.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenDisableFullScreen
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether or not to disable the full screen capabilities of the split screen control.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenOnlyLoadedDuringAjaxPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether or not the split screen is not output initially and only loaded during an ajax post back. Used for controls and other elements.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.SplitScreenDisableSmartScrolling
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether or not to disable the smart scrolling features. When used in a control the smart scrolling is not needed, so it is unnecessary to pass those parameters in the URL.

member.summary: Gets or sets the split screen y scroll.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreen.LeftPaneWidth

member.summary:
This method compares the current structure with another object of the same type. If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. NullableInt64 are ordered in following ascending order:
null NullableInt64.MinValue 0 NullableInt64.MaxValue
member.remarks: If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. This deviates from traditional mathmatical analysis, but is more useful in practical terms, so two objects of null value are determined to be equal, both having a value of null.
member.returns: An integer according the specification.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReaderWrapper
member.summary: Reader wrapper class provides for simple data access utilizing a forward only cursor. It provides a wrapper over the ADO.NET class.
member.remarks: The Reader class implements the interface and you should always invoked it in a statement or call Dispose when you are done with it.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReaderWrapper.#ctor(System.String)

member.remarks: The connectionString parameter must conform to valid syntax.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReaderWrapper.#ctor(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new SqlDataReader using the supplied connection object.
member.param: Connection object that will be opened if closed.
Sets whether to automatically close the connection when this SqlDataReader is disposed. Unless you will be reusing the connection, true is the recommended setting.
member.remarks:
You may wish to set the AutomaticallyCloseConnection property to false to manage the connection closing manually, otherwise the connection will be opened if it is closed then closed when this object is disposed.
AutomaticallyCloseConnectionIn Dispose
true (default)connection closed
falseconnection state unchanged

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReaderWrapper.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the SqlDataReader in two distinct scenarios.

item.term: directly or indirectly by user's code
Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
called by the runtime from inside the finalizer
should not reference other objects -- only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReaderWrapper.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes the SqlDataReader only if the Dispose method does not get called.
member.remarks: This gives a base class the opportunity to finalize. Do not provide destructors in types derived from this class.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.PropertyDefinitionData.IsObjectLoaded
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which determines whether or not the current object has been loaded from the database. The property is marked new so that each layer of the inheritence chain has it's own IsObjectLoaded property. Base layers may or may not be loaded. The IsObjectLoaded propery is automatically set to true when the object is loaded from the database. The IsObjectLoaded property is used primarily for the internal Load methods to determine whether or not the object needs to load itself when a property is accessed or the Load method is invoked.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.PropertyDefinitionData.IsObjectDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which determines whether or not the current object has been updated and needs to be saved to the database. The property is marked new so that each layer of the inheritence chain has it's own IsObjectDirty property. Base layers may or may not be dirty. The IsObjectDirty flag should set to true when a property is updated, and the object automatically sets the IsObjectDirty flag to false when the object is saved successfully. The IsObjectDirty property is used primarly for the internal Save methods to determine whether or not the object needs to save itself when the Save method is invoked.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.BusinessObjects.PropertyDefinitionData.IsObjectCreated
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag which determines whether or not the current object has just been created (is new) and will need to be saved to the database. The property is marked new so that each layer of the inheritence chain has it's own IsObjectCreated property. The IsObjectCreated flag is automatically set to false when the object is saved. Base layers may or may not be created. The IsObjectCreated flag is set to false when saved.

member.summary: Gets or sets the index position in the value list the values are located. Index starts at 0 and must be in order without gaps to work properly. (-1 [less than 0] means no value object exists for this form field)

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormField.JavaScriptOnAfterGetFieldText
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after retrieving the text for the field. The javascript code can be formatted like: function OnAfterGetFieldText(text) and needs to return the value and created before the head control.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormField.JavaScriptOnAfterGetFieldValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after retrieving the value for the field. The javascript code can be formatted like: function OnAfterGetFieldValue(value) and needs to return the value and created before the head control.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormField.JavaScriptOnBeforeSetFieldValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call before setting the value for the field. The javascript code can be formatted like: function OnBeforeSetFieldValue(value, text, tableCell) and needs to return the true or false flag indicating whether or not to proceed normally with setting the field value. Return false to perform custom field value setting. The "tableCell" field is occassionally passed for extended functionality.

member.name: P:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseTableFormField.JavaScriptOnAfterSetFieldValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript function to call after setting the value for the field. The javascript code can be formatted like: function OnAfterSetFieldValue(success, value, text) and needs to return the success flag indicating whether or not the field was set successfully or not.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDateTime.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this NullableDateTime structure to the supplied object and returns an indication of their relative values. If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned.
member.remarks: If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. This deviates from traditional null handling analysis, but is more useful in practical terms, so two objects of null value are determined to be equal, both having a value of null.
member.returns: An integer according the specification.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDateTime.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: This determines whether this instance and a specified object are equal. If both null then they are equal, if one of the two is null and the other is not then the values are not equal, otherwise a test of the underlying types is performed.
member.returns: This returns true if value and this instance are the same type and represent the same value (if both null then true); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDateTime.Equals(Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDateTime,Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDateTime)
member.summary: Performs a logical comparison of the two instances of structures to determine if they are equal. Note: Null is considered the least value. If both are null then they are equal. If both are null then returns true, if one of the two are null then returns false, otherwise performs a test of the underlying type.
member.returns:
Returns a bool. Returns True if the two values are equal, otherwise False.
If x is null and y is null then true is returned.
If x is null and y is NOT null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is null then false is returned.
If x is NOT null and y is NOT null then a test of the underyling type is returned.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities
member.summary: The static class full text search utilities helps formatting for SQL Server full text search capabilities. As of 11/11/2004 the class needs to be reviewed (STW).

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.noiseWords
member.summary: This stores objects whose name and value are equal. Each entry represents a unique noise word that will be excluded from a Full Text query string. Noise words are ignored when running Full Text queries, and an error will be thrown if all words in a query are noise words. Filtering them out allows us to determine if all words are noise words in which case we will not attempt to run the query.

member.name: F:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.MaximumFullTextWordProcessingLength
member.summary: This is the maximum length in characters of a string that will be processed by the character splitting full text search algorithm.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.#ctor
member.summary: This class cannot be instanciated.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.#cctor
member.summary: This static constructor, called once for the entire class before any object of this type is instantiated, initializes the noiseWords Hashtable.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.AddNoiseWord(System.String)
member.summary: This method adds a word to the list of noise words. Noise words are excluded from Full Text queries.
member.param: word to add to the noise word list.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.GetFullTextSearchDataPhrase(System.String)
member.summary: This method seperates phrase strings into individual words. Then, it separates words further to enable searching of substrings within those words.
member.example: Test is broken down to: test est st.
member.param: The phrase to separate into sub-words.
member.returns: Data prepared for Full Text search.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.GetFullTextDataWordSegments(System.String)
member.summary: GetFullTextDataWordSegments processes a word in preparation for including in a SQL Full-Text search. Since SQL Full-Text searches cannot return results similar to a WHERE LIKE clause it is necessary to provide each every possible "sub-word" of each word to be searched. For example: The word "wonderful" would need to be broken down into "wonderful, onderful, nderful, derful, erful, rful, ful, ul" so that all possible character patterns could be matched and returned.
member.returns: Returns a full-text processed string for a single word.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.RemoveNonAlphaNumericCharacters(System.String)
member.summary: RemoveNonAlphaNumericCharacters removes all non-word characters.
member.returns: Returns a string containing alpha-numeric characters separated by a single space.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.GetDataPhrase(System.Object[])
member.summary: Gets the data phrase which will be optimized to allow full text searching of partial words of all the parameters, the method breaks up the words into segments that SQL Server full text seaches can be queried on. The method works by calling the .ToString() method of each supplied in the object array input. STW Needs to be reviewed.
member.param: of objects to add to the data phrase for searching.
member.returns: Formatted which is now optimized to handle full text searching.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.Data.SqlClient.FullTextSearchUtilities.GetQueryString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the query string from the supplied which can be used to query the full text search fields and catalogs. STW Needs to be reviewed.
member.param: value to get the query string for.
member.returns: optimized for the searching.

member.name: T:Metafuse3.Web.UI.WebControls.MetafuseSplitScreenOld
member.summary: Control handles client side split screen capabilities, performs the hookups for the split screens. Normally 4 tables are supplied to make up the split screen, a "left pane header", "left pane", "right pane header" and "right pane". The control automatically adds the divider bar(s). Optionally the split screen can render a 2 pane split screen. When using a 2 pane split screen you must set the right pane header control and right pane control before the pre-render of the control. When using a split screen with 4 panes then all 4 must be set.

member.name: M:Metafuse3.NullableTypes.NullableDouble.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
This method compares the current structure with another object of the same type. If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. NullableDouble are ordered in following ascending order:
null NullableDouble.MinValue 0 NullableDouble.MaxValue
member.remarks: If both values are null, then 0 (equal) is returned. This deviates from traditional mathmatical analysis, but is more useful in practical terms, so two objects of null value are determined to be equal, both having a value of null.
member.returns: An integer according the specification.

member.returns: This returns true if value and this instance are the same type and represent the same value (if both null then true); otherwise, false.
